# Introduction to R and RStudio

## What is R?

R is a programming language designed for statistics and data analysis.\
It is heavily used in bioinformatics (RNA-seq, GWAS, microbiome,
proteomics).

## R vs RStudio

-   R = the engine that performs calculations
-   RStudio = the interface (IDE) where we write and manage code

Always write your code in a script (.R file), not only in the console.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

# Basic R Syntax

## Comments

``` {r}
# This is a comment
```

## Basic Arithmetic

``` {r}
2 + 2
5 * 3
10 / 2
2^3
```

------------------------------------------------------------------------

# Variables (Objects)

Everything in R is an object.

``` {r}
x <- 10
y <- 5
x + y
```

-   `<-` is assignment operator
-   R is case-sensitive

------------------------------------------------------------------------

# Data Types

## Numeric

``` {r}

class(num)
```

## Character

``` {r}

class(gene)
```

## Logical


# Functions

# Vectors

``` {r}
genes <- c("TP53", "BRCA1", "EGFR")
expression <- c(10.5, 8.2, 15.3)

genes[1]
expression[2]
```

------------------------------------------------------------------------

# Matrices

``` {r}
expr_matrix <- matrix(c(10,8,15,
                        12,9,14),
                      nrow = 3)

rownames(expr_matrix) <- c("TP53","BRCA1","EGFR")
colnames(expr_matrix) <- c("Sample1","Sample2")

expr_matrix
expr_matrix[1,2]
```

------------------------------------------------------------------------

# Data Frames

``` {r}
expr_df <- data.frame(
  Gene = c("TP53","BRCA1","EGFR"),
  Sample1 = c(10,8,15),
  Sample2 = c(12,9,14)
)

str(expr_df)
expr_df$Sample1
```

------------------------------------------------------------------------

# Tidyverse and dplyr

``` {r}
install.packages("tidyverse")
library(tidyverse)
```

## Pipe Operator

``` {r}
expr_df %>% head()
```

## dplyr Verbs

``` {r}
expr_df %>% select(Gene, Sample1)

expr_df %>% filter(Sample1 > 9)

expr_df %>% mutate(FoldChange = Sample2 / Sample1)

expr_df %>% arrange(desc(Sample1))

expr_df %>% summarise(mean_sample1 = mean(Sample1))

expr_df$Condition <- c("Control","Treatment","Treatment")

expr_df %>%
  group_by(Condition) %>%
  summarise(mean_expression = mean(Sample1))
```

------------------------------------------------------------------------

# Wide vs Long Omics Data

## pivot_longer()

``` {r}
expr_long <- expr_df %>%
  pivot_longer(
    cols = starts_with("Sample"),
    names_to = "Sample",
    values_to = "Expression"
  )
```

## pivot_wider()

``` {r}
expr_wide <- expr_long %>%
  pivot_wider(
    names_from = Sample,
    values_from = Expression
  )
```
